    <!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_header -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300 __970x90" id="fragranticacom_perfume_header" v-pre>

        <div class="grid-container" id="main-content">
                            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-x">
    <div class="small-12 medium-12 large-9 cell">

Top notes are Chinese Cinnamon Wood, Ginger and Bergamot; middle notes are Beeswax, Mate and Clary Sage; base notes are White Wine, Vanilla and Cashmeran. </p><p class="reviewstrigger" </fragram-photos-wrapper><div class="cell small-12"><div class="grid-x grid-padding-y" id="pyramid"><div class="cell"><div style="display: flex; flex-direction: column; justify-content: center; text-align: center; background: white;"><div class="strike-title"><span>Perfume Pyramid</span></div><pyramid-switch :perfume_id="46484"><pyramid-notes title="Main Notes According to Your Votes"></pyramid-notes><h4 style="margin-top: 0.5rem"><b>Top Notes</b></h4><pyramid-level notes="top"><div style="display: flex; justify-content: center; text-align: center; flex-wrap: wrap; align-items: flex-end; flex-direction: row; padding: 0.5rem;"><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 1; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.65.jpg" style="width: 5rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Cinnamon-65.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Chinese Cinnamon Wood</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 1; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.62.jpg" style="width: 4.9rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Ginger-62.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Ginger</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.92323619588367; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.75.jpg" style="width: 3.45rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Bergamot-75.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Bergamot</div></div></div>
</pyramid-level><h4 style="margin-top: 0.5rem"><b>Middle Notes</b></h4><pyramid-level notes="middle"><div style="display: flex; justify-content: center; text-align: center; flex-wrap: wrap; align-items: flex-end; flex-direction: row; padding: 0.5rem;"><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 1; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.53.jpg" style="width: 4.35rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Beeswax-53.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Beeswax</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.97738001487017; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.48.jpg" style="width: 3.825rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Mate-48.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Mate</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.82046435076082; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.164.jpg" style="width: 2.875rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Clary-Sage-164.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Clary Sage</div></div></div>
</pyramid-level><h4 style="margin-top: 0.5rem"><b>Base Notes</b></h4><pyramid-level notes="base"><div style="display: flex; justify-content: center; text-align: center; flex-wrap: wrap; align-items: flex-end; flex-direction: row; padding: 0.5rem;"><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.93475271741739; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.543.jpg" style="width: 3.525rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/White-Wine-543.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>White Wine</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.88630790722059; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.74.jpg" style="width: 3.225rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Vanilla-74.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Vanilla</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.73508893593265; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.348.jpg" style="width: 2.5rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Cashmeran-348.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Cashmeran</div></div></div>

<div class="newslist cell small-12 large-6">
    <img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/news/en/12774/news.12774-120x120.jpg" alt="Helen, Teddy, and Mr. Harrod: Keeping Up Appearances" style="margin-right: 1em; flex-shrink: 0">    <div class="flex-child-auto">
        <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/news/Helen-Teddy-and-Mr-Harrod-Keeping-Up-Appearances-12774.html">
            <span class="clickcatcher"></span><h4>Helen, Teddy, and Mr. Harrod: Keeping Up Appearances</h4>
        </a>
        <p>by <i>Alex (Sane-Witch) Osipov</i></p>
        <div class="right-bottom-corner-abs">            10/01/19 11:30

height: 1rem;"></like><span class="show-for-medium">Positive Reviews</span></a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#popular-negative-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><dislike style="width: 1rem;     <div class="strike-title"><span>All Reviews By Date</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
        <div class="cell destinationreview"></div>                    <div id="parent1915300" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1915300" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alleycatseyes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1063886"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1063886.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alleycatseyes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1915300ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1915300" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1063886">alleycatseyes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-30">08/30/23 08:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>@ambergeese I find many reviews quite fascinating. id like to share some insights with you. Perfume, as an old factory art form, transcends the boundaries of race ethnicity. It serves as a universal means of self expression, appreciated by individuals from diverse backgrounds and cultures.<br />
<br />
This perfume has a Sicilian name attached to it. Making your review insensitive.<br />
<br />
Fragrance choices are deeply personal, reflecting, unique, preferences, and experiences. By embracing the diverse tapestry of perfume enthusiast, we can gain a richer understanding of the intricate connections between scent, culture, and individual identity.<br />
<br />
Cultivating an inclusive mindset, enables us to appreciate the nuances and complexities of fragrance as they intersect with various races and ethnicities. It all allows us to celebrate the beauty of diverse perspectives, fostering an environment of intellectual growth and cultural appreciation.<br />
<br />
So, let us embark on a journey to explore the captivating world of fragrance together, appreciating its intricate nuances and the myriad of ways it intertwines with our shared human experience.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1915300"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1915300#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1704175" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1704175" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ilove2009"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1332070"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1332070.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ilove2009" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/One-Day/Taipei-92210.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.92210.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Taipei"title="Taipei"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1704175ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1704175" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1332070">Ilove2009</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-07">12/07/22 11:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A delicious and refine scent. Not overly sweet. <br />
The perfume balanced beautiful between sweetness and spiciness.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1704175"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1704175#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1607975" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1607975" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AryanasPerfumes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1209539"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="AryanasPerfumes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/I-Don-t-Need-A-Prince-By-My-Side-To-Be-A-Princess-50497.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50497.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="I Don't Need A Prince By My Side To Be A Princess"title="I Don't Need A Prince By My Side To Be A Princess"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1607975ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1607975" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1209539">AryanasPerfumes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-21">07/21/22 17:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells very herbal, like sweet and sour tea, literally. Imagine making yourself a cup of spicy tea and putting lemon in it and it`s hot, so the steam comes to your nose and that`s what you smell. I havent smelled anything like it before,perfume wise. I dont know if I like it or if I would like to wear it. I am experimenting with it for now.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1607975"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1607975#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1516885" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1516885" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="diaanz81"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1225540"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1225540.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="diaanz81" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1516885ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1516885" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1225540">diaanz81</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-05">03/05/22 01:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Dorothea has a spicy kick in the opening from a strong ginger note, aided also by cinnamon to my nose. A fleeting citrus note cuts through what could be an overwhelmingly spicy opening to some but this mellows somewhat over time. I was quite taken aback by it when I first got my bottle however, now I really love the spiced punch that this fragrance packs, especially when the weather gets cooler. I also get a honeyed herbal tea note and everything is wrapped in a beautiful gourmand vanilla which complements the gingery spice that lasts the entire duration of the fragrance. The resulting scent is very warm, very comforting and evokes deep feelings of nostalgia in me by making me envisage a very classic Christmas scene of decorating the tree in my favorite cozy sweater with my family as the sounds of laughter, children playing and Christmas carols fills my home, along with the mouthwatering aroma of ginger cookies baking in the oven. To me, this is Christmas in a bottle!  <br />
<br />
I have a few bottles from the portraits collection and most of them have notoriously poor to just moderate performance, Dorothea is an exception. Performance was surprisingly good 5 - 6 hrs longevity with moderate projection and sillage. I find it to be a unisex gourmand fragrance but can see why it is marketed towards women. Side note, I also love that this bottle has a lid fashioned to look like an owl which is my chosen spirit animal. Definitely give this sniff if you can and don't be quick to write it off, Dorothea might surprise you as she did me!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1516885"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1516885#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1515484" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1515484" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Zethre"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1262397"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1262397.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Zethre" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Amazone-1974-4656.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4656.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Amazone (1974)"title="Amazone (1974)"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1515484ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1515484" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1262397">Zethre</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-03">03/03/22 00:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sweet, modern, vanilla in the background. I don't seem to get the spices etc. I love the name, but the the scent was meh for me</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1515484"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1515484#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0; border: none; margin: 0;"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6 -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6" v-pre>
</div></div><div id="parent1510525" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1510525" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Parfumsqui.surprise"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1450872"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Parfumsqui.surprise" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1510525ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1510525" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1450872">Parfumsqui.surprise</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-23">02/23/22 11:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells like absolutely nothing I have smelled before, I see people comparing this to other gourmands scents that I have sampled, and my immediate thought is...NOPE! This is stunning and incredibly unique. To my nose, it smells like a delicious chai latte with honey and cinnamon served with warm freshly baked gingerbread cookies. The scent is inspired by afternoon tea, and Penhaligon's did such an outstanding job capturing the essence of such an experience. I only wish they offered an extrait/extreme version, because this scent is so light, with a small scent bubble, no sillage, no projection, and no lasting power. After about 30 minutes it becomes a skin scent that you're only going to smell in intimate situations such as hugging. So you really need to spray generously and reapply often. My absolute favorite from this collection!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1510525"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1510525#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1497407" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1497407" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="*loves_shoes*"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1407258"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1407258.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="*loves_shoes*" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Babycat-73149.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.73149.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Babycat"title="Babycat"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1497407ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1497407" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1407258">*loves_shoes*</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-04">02/04/22 03:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Edit: Since writing the review below Ive had covid, and now this smells really strongly of warm spice. And not much else. I really could smell more lemon and vanilla before, but now its just warm spice all the way. Smells more like Shalimar Philtre than Lira to me now, although its much spicier. Its crazy how everyones smell is just slightly different! <br />
<br />
When I smelled this I knew Id smelled it before, but couldnt place it for awhile, probably because it reminds me of something Id never associate with this.<br />
Lira by Xerjoff. <br />
Now they are not the same, and not dupes at all. However, Dorothea has a citrus, cinammon, vanilla opening, exactly the same as Lira, only not as sweet. <br />
As Dorothea dries down the ginger and other drier, more aromatic spices (sage and mate I guess) become more prominent, and the similarity to Lira begins to widen. It becomes aromatic (which Lira is definitely not!) but still has a caramel sweetness to it. <br />
If you find Lira just that bit too sweet try this. Id even go as far to say it could be a masculine version of Lira. An aromatic citrus cinnamon spiced caramel. <br />
Although discontinued, its still available often in UK fragrance groups as Penhaligons had it as a prize in one of their games in mid 2021.<br />
I dont get any wine, thankfully, and it projects and lasts fine on me, although possibly not as long as Lira which is ridiculous, but Im happy with 6-7 hours.<br />
<br />
I tried it again, with more sprays, and this time I definitely get much more herbal beeswax. Like a cross between 4160 TuesdaysCaptured by Candlelight and the aforementioned Lira. With a huge helping of spice drawer.<br />
<br />
Edit: also a similar type of scent to Ani by Nishane, although not a dupe.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1497407"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1497407#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1439786" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1439786" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Murmur123123"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1310171"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Murmur123123" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1439786ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1439786" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1310171">Murmur123123</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-04">11/04/21 01:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>my first thought upon spraying it: sugar and spice! Not sugar in the sense of sickly sweetness, but more like a ginger and cinnamon cookie of medium sweetness level. Very interesting choice for autumn and winter, but both the projection and lasting power are disappointing (and considering its high full retail price...)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1439786"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1439786#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1420293" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1420293" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ambergeese"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1348862"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1348862.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ambergeese" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nasomatto/Baraonda-40200.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40200.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Baraonda"title="Baraonda"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1420293ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1420293" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1348862">ambergeese</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-01">10/01/21 11:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The marketing is amusingly correct on this one: this is a rich middle-aged white lady smell. The amusing part is the way the scent marketing posits her as a grand mysterious dame of old. Cashmere, white wine, and the herbs-and-honey background scent of her house? Please. Dorothea is a contemporary countess. She won't poison your tea, but she will shoot dagger eyes at you across the PTA meeting and give you a big fake plastic smile as she shows you around one of those big taupe American houses with the wannabe-McMansion aesthetic. She is the perfect archetypal character of the powerful and ruthless countess of old made contemporary, which I think is hilarious and brilliant. Hats off to Penhaligon's for the story this one tells.<br />
<br />
Though that might sound cynical, Dorothea is genuinely a very comforting fragrance with a genius note pyramid. The notes are all distinguishable, but blended together well, and each is selected towards a stack of scents that both symbolically and aesthetically work together in a way that is nothing short of art.<br />
<br />
She is warming in a way that is airy and breathable, but also a bit cloying and dusty, like lying in a patch of sun on an old carpet floor as a child in your parents' bedroom, relishing the warm spot in a house kept a few degrees below a comfortable temperature. You crush as much of your skin as possible into that carpet floor to soak up all the warmth you can, even as you can feel the creeping ick of all that dust tickling you all over. That's the duality of comfort and unease that Dorothea serves up.<br />
<br />
As she opens the door and invites you into her home, you're hit by a few different scents simultaneously. In the first hour or two, you're enchanted by a sweet treat she's been baking in her oven: thin, crispy gingersnap cookies, with plenty of cinnamon and the gentlest, mildest hint of ginger. The spices are mild and sweet, mellowed out by the process of baking. The aroma of cinnamon gingersnaps wafts all around you in the kitchen as you turn around and peer into the dining room, sensing another scent...<br />
<br />
The wine! Some sprigs of sage are subtly hidden in the artful decor of the room, and the dining room table holds a beautiful uncorked bottle of white wine, with two glasses beside it. The wine has already been poured. It is for you. The sight of just those two glasses on that long white table sends chills down your spine, though you can't say why. The subtle scent of fine white wine -- not of drunkenness or of perfume alcohol, but of wine, uncorked -- floats around you, intertwining itself with the slightly smoky scent of springs of sage. Has a candle been burning? There will be candles, tonight.<br />
<br />
The texture of the fragrance throughout, and particularly within the first 2-3 hours, is strongly shaped by cashmeran. This smells strongly and convincingly of a cashmere sweater, which really makes up the body of the confident-rich-lady effect the storytelling pulls off here. It feels delicious, wealthy, and substantial, with living, breathing texture to grab onto and breathe in. This whole big house, too clean, too shiny, too pristinely laid as if it were a trap, it all seems reflected in that fine beige or gray cashmere sweater, and in the hints of aromas that cashmere oh-so-easily picks up. Someone was here before you. Someone will be here afterwards.<br />
<br />
On me, Dorothea is, at her heart, a beeswax scent, a little cloying and dirty and sickly-sweet, with absolutely delicious edges of yerba mate accentuating the grounded facets of the honey and wax and keeping the sweetness from floating off to cupcake land. Beeswax fascinates me; I think it is one of the loveliest scents in the world, but it is also a little too much for me in its thorough, cloying, biting sweetness, like a grape or a chocolate that bites at the back of your throat as you swallow, too sweet, not in an airy perfumey way, but in a grounded and surrounding way that can feel a little suffocating. This works in the favor of the world Dorothea creates: it's a little too sweet in a way that's sinister, but oh, it's so beautiful, in a way that is mature, that takes up the space it deserves, that knows what it wants and guns for it. This is the room scent of fine artisanal candles that burn here every night, and a hint of the tea that Dorothea brews herself the next morning, when the ritual is done, as she scans her planner from Marshall's for the next PTA meeting or soccer game, filing her nails and smiling to herself.<br />
<br />
I don't gatekeep fragrances based on demographics like gender and age, and I personally tend to hew towards more mature, powerful scents, but the character of Dorothea is constructed so precisely that even I do not know if I can pull her off with my personality. I may be the thrifted-cashmere-sweater-loving "mom friend", but something about this feels genuinely older than I am now, in a way that I can both poke fun at and simultaneously secretly admire and wish for. The most challenging notes for me in this regard are the undeniably rich and mature cashmere as well as the spices, which start to lean generic-pumpkin-spice at some moments of the drydown. Nevertheless, I will enjoy the comfort of my sample, and decide from there whether I am someone who can wear her properly. She really is lovely, and the storytelling of this one really entertains me. Above all, she is comforting, but there is something sinister in her power that I find absolutely delightful.<br />
<br />
The projection leans towards being intimate from the very beginning  this is no beast mode fragrance  but it's still very usable and respectable. A subtle volume suits the fragrance well. It makes you dig for all those mysterious subtleties as it transitions through its various delicious stages. The performance is moderately acceptable as well, with Dorothea lasting some 8 hours, clinging faintly but distinctly to the body through much of that time, and leaves a barely-there trace of spices on skin for several hours more. Her whispers are self-assured and powerful. I tell myself she is not for me, that she is not right for me, that she's too fickle and grand in her tastes, too pricey and high-maintenance, and yet... I keep waking up hearing her calling my name from a dream again.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1420293"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1420293#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1417323" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1417323" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Maleoh"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1378962"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1378962.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Maleoh" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1417323ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1417323" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1378962">Maleoh</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-26">09/26/21 09:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Shivers down my spine. I love it so much. I spray it mainly late afternoon and it comforts me. <br />
I've tried several other portraits and this one can't be compared notably in longevity. It's a beautiful warm spicy vanilla. It's worth a try if you love that kind of scents</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1417323"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1417323#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1375127" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1375127" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LadyofWahey"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1195068"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1195068.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LadyofWahey" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1375127ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1375127" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1195068">LadyofWahey</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-07-13">07/13/21 05:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There once was a ruthless young countess<br />
Dorothea by name, she cried Oh, bless!<br />
One wants me on one's side<br />
When out for a ride<br />
Or there'll be trouble ahead, a faiblesse!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1375127"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1375127#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1356510" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1356510" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TunyaPe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/733870"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.733870.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TunyaPe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Fils-de-Joie-62872.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62872.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fils de Joie"title="Fils de Joie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1356510ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1356510" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/733870">TunyaPe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-08">06/08/21 06:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is English desserts served with my favourite Darjeeling tea (I know it is a weird combination). <br />
<br />
Highly unique. Very spicy. A bit fresh, a bit sweet, a bit gourmand, well-blended. It is just tantalisingly mouthwatering that it sent me to heaven every time I wore.<br />
<br />
Countess Dorothea is my true love, despite her ruthlessly poor sillage &amp; longevity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1356510"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1356510#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1347654" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1347654" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vanian"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/132632"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.132632.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vanian" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1347654ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1347654" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/132632">Vanian</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-22">05/22/21 11:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wonderful caramel/toffee, edible deliciousness in a bottle. Great scent for a lady who is preparing to go out for lunch and who just happened to finish baking her trademark traditional cinnamon cookies which she aims to give to her friends as a Christmas gift. This to my nose is a gourmand scent, but not sickly sweet,  not even sweet just perfect. It starts just little bit aromatic, maybe the sage is very noticeable in the first 5-7min but that quickly settles down and then all ingredients well blended appears at once. Very Christmas-y, cinnamon biscuits and toffee and Earl Grey tea with a bit of milk in it. Yummy. I was raving recently about Stephanie (de Monaco) the perfume to be returned on the market and bumped into this. Now, I don't really care if Stephanie will come back, this is as similar enough. Gorgeous, in my next to buy list. <br />
Is this for a ferocious matriarch? Hm, I don't know, really, I find it suitable for age group 25 years old ladies and beyond that age, definitely.  Personal choice, obviously.<br />
Penhaligon's, please do never discontinue this fragrance!<br />
p.s. I couldn't wait,  I got it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1347654"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1347654#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1323191" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1323191" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SweetBriar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1018716"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1018716.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SweetBriar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Guidance-78656.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78656.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Guidance"title="Guidance"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1323191ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1323191" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1018716">SweetBriar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-10">04/10/21 15:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells quite masculine- not sweet at all- almost bitter. Definitely a black tea with ginger but not sweetened and more ginger than tea.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1323191"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1323191#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1319200" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1319200" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jero"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/72622"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.72622.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jero" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Dior-Addict-Eau-de-Toilette-25159.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25159.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dior Addict Eau de Toilette "title="Dior Addict Eau de Toilette "></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1319200ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1319200" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/72622">jero</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-04">04/04/21 05:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't know what's mate tea tasted like and for me Ruthless Countess Dorothea smelled like delicious flavoured black tea.<br />
<br />
A tea perfume like dessert, a youthful and next door good girl than the name suggested an old and hard to get along with lady. And don't know why this has a portrait with the owl.<br />
<br />
Maybe RCD is for everybody's young golden dream.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1319200"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1319200#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1308403" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1308403" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="salthewitch"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1157751"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1157751.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="salthewitch" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Valentino/Valentino-Donna-31411.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31411.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Valentino Donna"title="Valentino Donna"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1308403ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1308403" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1157751">salthewitch</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-15">03/15/21 18:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The Countess was my first foray into the world of Portraits, and despite her sharing my Mother in laws name, I didn't hold it against her. I was actually matched on the Penhaligon's site with this as a sample, despite it being so far removed from my comfort zone it'd be akin to Bill Gates going to an Apple convention. I've since gone all in on Penhaligan's, much to my bank balances chagrin. I wasn't prepared for to fall in love with a woman, let alone THIS woman. She is seductive, playful and practically edible with her smoky cum vanilla cinnamon opening. Still swirling on dry down, sagey beeswax comes into play and it all blends absolutely divinely. I don't get the wine, the ginger is delicate and comes and goes, but this absolute belter of amber nectar is encompassed in the flacon she so rightly commands. I don't see her in cashmere, more in silk velvet. She may be ruthless, but she is also stunning and she'll dance all night and keep going the next day. Beautiful.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1308403"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1308403#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1280398" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1280821">ingeneuxo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-23">01/23/21 02:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>-Opens with a blast of cinnamon.<br />
-Dry down: vanilla/ ginger cookie<br />
-Longevity: Low. Turns into a skin scent in 1 hour, but lingers overnight on clothing.<br />
-Projection: Low-Medium <br />
-The house of Penhaligon's makes perfumes that are EDT concentration at best imo.<br />
-So far, nothing from the house of Penhaligon's have managed to impress me.<br />
-Not fbw (-)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1280398"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1280398#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1238367" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1238367" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="justine_gayle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1836"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1836.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="justine_gayle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Soleil-de-Feu-80083.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.80083.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Soleil de Feu"title="Soleil de Feu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1238367ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1238367" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1836">justine_gayle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-10-18">10/18/20 19:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's been 11 years since my last review. My taste in perfume has significantly changed from cute girl to classy woman. Countess Dorothea is the best transition I've ever made. It's elegant, powerful, and sweet but not overbearing. It's seductive, mysterious, and regal. It was love at first sniff. I don't understand why this isn't a popular choice. It truly is a gem. Let's keep this our secret then! </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1238367"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1238367#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1118488" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1118488" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Use_me_as_light"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1086044"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1086044.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Use_me_as_light" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46484.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Ruthless Countess Dorothea"title="The Ruthless Countess Dorothea"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1118488ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck8x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1118488" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1086044">Use_me_as_light</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-11-24">11/24/19 03:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is my favorite fragrance at the moment and I am enjoying every minute with it. <br />
<br />
It is like Christmas in the bottle, so warm, soothing, sweet-spicy, with liqueur-undertones. It does not change much during the day, the silage is noticeable, but delicate. <br />
<br />
This is a gourmand, that will not choke people around you. Cinnamon is prominent, the mate-note gives this scent a hint of freshness, the ginger is not sharp and does not turn into the dirty-warm mess, like in Twilly.<br />
<br />
It breaks my heart, hearing that this beauty can be discontinued.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1118488"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1118488#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1117441" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1023338" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tandaina"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/987927"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.987927.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tandaina" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Mitsouko-Eau-de-Parfum-25316.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25316.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mitsouko Eau de Parfum"title="Mitsouko Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1023338ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1023338" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);
