I adore spicy scents, glad I tested it, as this one doesn't work.<br />
<br />
I honestly can't tell which note or notes is causing the issue, the whole thing is too muddled and confused on my skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1023338"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1023338#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1015052" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1015052" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Marshmallowmarsupial"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/162882"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Marshmallowmarsupial" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1015052ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1015052" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/162882">Marshmallowmarsupial</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-12-30">12/30/18 17:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I enjoy this quite a bit. My skin amplifies sweeter notes, and on me the tea/bergamot/honey/wine notes blend in a scent reminiscent of roobios and apples. Theres a hint of smoke here tooneither an acrid bonfire smoke nor a woodsy fireplace smoke more like the delicate curling wisp of smoke from a candle. That and the well-blended spice keep the sweetness from becoming too cloying or childish.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1015052"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1015052#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent992184" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc992184" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cristinaeeee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/504130"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.504130.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cristinaeeee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mind-Games/Queening-89898.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.89898.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Queening"title="Queening"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma992184ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd992184" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/504130">cristinaeeee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-10-17">10/17/18 09:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have worn my sample twice (sample from the Aedes website) and I am getting a totally different experience with this beautiful DOROTHEA.  Not quite ruthless but rather sweet and devilishly delectable.  Without checking the notes, I applied and sniffed my wrist ... why am I getting a sweet chocolatey-orange liqueur?  I decided to apply this gorgeous juice behind my ears and on my other wrist -- oh, goodness! The citrus is luscious and thickened by the vanilla, cinnamon and beeswax but it never gets heavy.  Besides being the addictive nectar that it is, this one leaves a delightful scent on your skin way beyond the 8 hour mark.<br />
<br />
Edit:  I now have a full bottle of this and I love it!  It's going to be my Christmas scent this year as mix of the sweet notes and delectable spices smell quite festive to me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="992184"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=992184#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent987098" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc987098" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="m&aacute;rti.vincze"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/199532"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.199532.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="m&aacute;rti.vincze" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma987098ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd987098" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/199532">m&aacute;rti.vincze</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-10-01">10/01/18 15:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells EXACTLY like Unknown Pleasures by the House of Kerosene. So much so that I don't need a bottle of this, I already have Unknown Pleasures. The scent is amazing, but with Kerosene you get a better value for a huge 100ml bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="987098"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=987098#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent975585" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc975585" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="halogencat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1150280"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1150280.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="halogencat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Marks-Spencer/White-Coconut-66988.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66988.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="White Coconut"title="White Coconut"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma975585ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd975585" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1150280">halogencat</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-08-26">08/26/18 07:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I think I'd love this as a home fragrance - it's a few degrees too sweet for me to personally want to wear (I've been enjoying wearing the sample out, but at 185 for the full size anything less than a perfect fit would be a mistake) but I think it'd be a really lovely, inviting and warm scent for a candle, or as a mist to make fresh bedlinen feel even cozier in the winter. <br />
It is a really masterful and unique scent though - all the notes they claim to be there are distinctly noticeable, and it definitely changes throughout the day: initially a huge wave of spices, especially the tingly ginger-lime note, before the sage and sweet beeswax and boozy cashmeran skin scent (though the ginger and sage are detectable in the skin scent too - there's definitely ginger from start to finish, although it settles from the really sharp, hot (kind of a 'thai curry') smell with the lime at the start into a sweeter gingerbread later on. <br />
It's definitely very special and interesting - I honestly wish that either it fit me a little more, so I could justify saving up for a bottle as a signature scent rather than simply because it interests me, or that they would release more products with this fragrance - I'd happily spend around 40 on a candle that could fill my home with this bewitching scent for hours on end.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="975585"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=975585#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent959162" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc959162" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Chicago Tony T"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/773746"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.773746.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Chicago Tony T" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rasasi/Daarej-pour-Homme-19688.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.19688.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Daarej pour Homme"title="Daarej pour Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma959162ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd959162" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/773746">Chicago Tony T</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-07-06">07/06/18 12:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tested this one from a dab on sample and smelled it the next morning. Supreme longevity for such a mild and delicate fragrance. Easily unisex and the prices have dropped significantly so I would assume that more people are purchasing it now. The beeswax and spicy notes are very easy to detect which makes this gourmand but not over the top. Due to it's mildness it can be worn year round and just about any occasion.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="959162"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=959162#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent939493" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It is definitely not for young girl.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="939493"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=939493#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent932222" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; As it dries, The Ruthless Countess brings to mind a satisfying aperitif- it's all honeyed vanilla and lightly spiced fruits.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="932222"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=932222#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent917560" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Oh how I wish I could spray it!!! {mental note; in future where possible get samples which spray}<br />
 Anyhow, clary sage and bergamot are a couple of my fave smells, and  this scent contains both. Not in spades, mind you, but still present.<br />
 This scent,is soft, suitable for the Office or a Summer Garden Party/ Wedding. This perfume is going on my' must try in spray form list'</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="917560"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=917560#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent898393" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc891336" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="supertw94109"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1066516"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1066516.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="supertw94109" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Embruns-d-Ylang-55251.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55251.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Embruns d'Ylang"title="Embruns d'Ylang"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma891336ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd891336" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1066516">supertw94109</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-12-18">12/18/17 12:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sweetness is the dominating theme of this perfume. It's not cocoa, vanilla type of gourmand sweetness but reminds me of the brown sugar sweetness in Equinox Bloom with a mild ginger oil and very light lime around the edges. It did not seem beeswaxy or winey or herbal unless it's around the edges.It's pretty good but I'm not sure it's complete. I would like there to be some more evolution beyond the sweetness. I only tested one spray on my hand so I will need to spray on my pulse points next time to get a better picture. It is rather unique since I have not encountered this type of sweetness before.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="891336"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=891336#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent889006" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc889006" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="DBF85"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1024668"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1024668.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="DBF85" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Kelly-Caleche-1335.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1335.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Kelly Calche"title="Kelly Calche"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma889006ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd889006" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1024668">DBF85</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-12-11">12/11/17 07:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sweet, Caramel, Toffee .. those were initial thoughts.<br />
<br />
Its not the suffocating sweet perfume. On the contrary, sweet in a mild why. Might be because of the Ginger and Lime. <br />
<br />
I think what makes this perfume a success, moderation. Notes do not overwhelme each other. They work together. <br />
<br />
The perfume is more on the feminine side.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="889006"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=889006#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent870326" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc870326" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Q80"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/698615"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.698615.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Q80" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma870326ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd870326" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/698615">Q80</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-10-13">10/13/17 03:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>IMPRESSIVE! CAPTIVATING!<br />
<br />
Ginger, white wine, cinnamon, honey, mate, and hints of sage. The lime is supporting the white wine somehow to give that sour boosting as the ginger helps with that sharpness effect. I believe there is vetiver as well, not the dirty but the mild.<br />
<br />
This is very captivating! As i never thought that Penhaligon's would ever going to impress me anymore! and i was wrong, dead wrong! this is quite solid, and very unique!<br />
<br />
Edit (3rd Jan 2018) This is like lemon lime tart with mild sweetness and tasteful sourness. Very interesting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="870326"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=870326#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent865475" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1061765">cocolover56</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-09-28">09/28/17 08:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This one gets majorly love from me. It's so meticulously blended that it becomes this hardcore 'indescribable' scent. A term I reserve for those that truly perplex me. Ginger, I guess, is truly the most detectable note although they all really are. <br />
<br />
This one is something that is made up mainly of accords, rather than individual notes that can be closely and intimately detected.<br />
<br />
Calvini actually describes it pretty perfectly. Except, I'd change the 'not bad' to 'bloody excellent'</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="865475"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=865475#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent865458" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; </div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1118488" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1118488" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Use_me_as_light"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1086044"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1086044.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Use_me_as_light" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46484.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Ruthless Countess Dorothea"title="The Ruthless Countess Dorothea"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1118488ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck8x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1118488" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1086044">Use_me_as_light</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-11-24">11/24/19 03:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is my favorite fragrance at the moment and I am enjoying every minute with it. <br />
<br />
It is like Christmas in the bottle, so warm, soothing, sweet-spicy, with liqueur-undertones. It does not change much during the day, the silage is noticeable, but delicate. <br />
<br />
This is a gourmand, that will not choke people around you. Cinnamon is prominent, the mate-note gives this scent a hint of freshness, the ginger is not sharp and does not turn into the dirty-warm mess, like in Twilly.<br />
<br />
It breaks my heart, hearing that this beauty can be discontinued.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1118488"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1118488#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent992184" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc992184" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cristinaeeee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/504130"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.504130.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cristinaeeee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mind-Games/Queening-89898.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.89898.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Queening"title="Queening"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma992184ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd992184" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/504130">cristinaeeee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-10-17">10/17/18 09:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have worn my sample twice (sample from the Aedes website) and I am getting a totally different experience with this beautiful DOROTHEA.  Not quite ruthless but rather sweet and devilishly delectable.  Without checking the notes, I applied and sniffed my wrist ... why am I getting a sweet chocolatey-orange liqueur?  I decided to apply this gorgeous juice behind my ears and on my other wrist -- oh, goodness! The citrus is luscious and thickened by the vanilla, cinnamon and beeswax but it never gets heavy.  Besides being the addictive nectar that it is, this one leaves a delightful scent on your skin way beyond the 8 hour mark.<br />
<br />
Edit:  I now have a full bottle of this and I love it!  It's going to be my Christmas scent this year as mix of the sweet notes and delectable spices smell quite festive to me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="992184"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=992184#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1356510" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1356510" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TunyaPe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/733870"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.733870.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TunyaPe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Fils-de-Joie-62872.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62872.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fils de Joie"title="Fils de Joie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1356510ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1356510" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/733870">TunyaPe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-08">06/08/21 06:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is English desserts served with my favourite Darjeeling tea (I know it is a weird combination). <br />
<br />
Highly unique. Very spicy. A bit fresh, a bit sweet, a bit gourmand, well-blended. It is just tantalisingly mouthwatering that it sent me to heaven every time I wore.<br />
<br />
Countess Dorothea is my true love, despite her ruthlessly poor sillage &amp; longevity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1356510"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1356510#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1510525" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1510525" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Parfumsqui.surprise"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1450872"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Parfumsqui.surprise" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1510525ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1510525" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1450872">Parfumsqui.surprise</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-23">02/23/22 11:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells like absolutely nothing I have smelled before, I see people comparing this to other gourmands scents that I have sampled, and my immediate thought is...NOPE! This is stunning and incredibly unique. To my nose, it smells like a delicious chai latte with honey and cinnamon served with warm freshly baked gingerbread cookies. The scent is inspired by afternoon tea, and Penhaligon's did such an outstanding job capturing the essence of such an experience. I only wish they offered an extrait/extreme version, because this scent is so light, with a small scent bubble, no sillage, no projection, and no lasting power. After about 30 minutes it becomes a skin scent that you're only going to smell in intimate situations such as hugging. So you really need to spray generously and reapply often. My absolute favorite from this collection!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1510525"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1510525#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1420293" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1420293" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ambergeese"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1348862"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1348862.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ambergeese" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nasomatto/Baraonda-40200.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40200.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Baraonda"title="Baraonda"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1420293ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1420293" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1348862">ambergeese</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-01">10/01/21 11:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The marketing is amusingly correct on this one: this is a rich middle-aged white lady smell. The amusing part is the way the scent marketing posits her as a grand mysterious dame of old. Cashmere, white wine, and the herbs-and-honey background scent of her house? Please. Dorothea is a contemporary countess. She won't poison your tea, but she will shoot dagger eyes at you across the PTA meeting and give you a big fake plastic smile as she shows you around one of those big taupe American houses with the wannabe-McMansion aesthetic. She is the perfect archetypal character of the powerful and ruthless countess of old made contemporary, which I think is hilarious and brilliant. Hats off to Penhaligon's for the story this one tells.<br />
<br />
Though that might sound cynical, Dorothea is genuinely a very comforting fragrance with a genius note pyramid. The notes are all distinguishable, but blended together well, and each is selected towards a stack of scents that both symbolically and aesthetically work together in a way that is nothing short of art.<br />
<br />
She is warming in a way that is airy and breathable, but also a bit cloying and dusty, like lying in a patch of sun on an old carpet floor as a child in your parents' bedroom, relishing the warm spot in a house kept a few degrees below a comfortable temperature. You crush as much of your skin as possible into that carpet floor to soak up all the warmth you can, even as you can feel the creeping ick of all that dust tickling you all over. That's the duality of comfort and unease that Dorothea serves up.<br />
<br />
As she opens the door and invites you into her home, you're hit by a few different scents simultaneously. In the first hour or two, you're enchanted by a sweet treat she's been baking in her oven: thin, crispy gingersnap cookies, with plenty of cinnamon and the gentlest, mildest hint of ginger. The spices are mild and sweet, mellowed out by the process of baking. The aroma of cinnamon gingersnaps wafts all around you in the kitchen as you turn around and peer into the dining room, sensing another scent...<br />
<br />
The wine! Some sprigs of sage are subtly hidden in the artful decor of the room, and the dining room table holds a beautiful uncorked bottle of white wine, with two glasses beside it. The wine has already been poured. It is for you. The sight of just those two glasses on that long white table sends chills down your spine, though you can't say why. The subtle scent of fine white wine -- not of drunkenness or of perfume alcohol, but of wine, uncorked -- floats around you, intertwining itself with the slightly smoky scent of springs of sage. Has a candle been burning? There will be candles, tonight.<br />
<br />
The texture of the fragrance throughout, and particularly within the first 2-3 hours, is strongly shaped by cashmeran. This smells strongly and convincingly of a cashmere sweater, which really makes up the body of the confident-rich-lady effect the storytelling pulls off here. It feels delicious, wealthy, and substantial, with living, breathing texture to grab onto and breathe in. This whole big house, too clean, too shiny, too pristinely laid as if it were a trap, it all seems reflected in that fine beige or gray cashmere sweater, and in the hints of aromas that cashmere oh-so-easily picks up. Someone was here before you. Someone will be here afterwards.<br />
<br />
On me, Dorothea is, at her heart, a beeswax scent, a little cloying and dirty and sickly-sweet, with absolutely delicious edges of yerba mate accentuating the grounded facets of the honey and wax and keeping the sweetness from floating off to cupcake land. Beeswax fascinates me; I think it is one of the loveliest scents in the world, but it is also a little too much for me in its thorough, cloying, biting sweetness, like a grape or a chocolate that bites at the back of your throat as you swallow, too sweet, not in an airy perfumey way, but in a grounded and surrounding way that can feel a little suffocating. This works in the favor of the world Dorothea creates: it's a little too sweet in a way that's sinister, but oh, it's so beautiful, in a way that is mature, that takes up the space it deserves, that knows what it wants and guns for it. This is the room scent of fine artisanal candles that burn here every night, and a hint of the tea that Dorothea brews herself the next morning, when the ritual is done, as she scans her planner from Marshall's for the next PTA meeting or soccer game, filing her nails and smiling to herself.<br />
<br />
I don't gatekeep fragrances based on demographics like gender and age, and I personally tend to hew towards more mature, powerful scents, but the character of Dorothea is constructed so precisely that even I do not know if I can pull her off with my personality. I may be the thrifted-cashmere-sweater-loving "mom friend", but something about this feels genuinely older than I am now, in a way that I can both poke fun at and simultaneously secretly admire and wish for. The most challenging notes for me in this regard are the undeniably rich and mature cashmere as well as the spices, which start to lean generic-pumpkin-spice at some moments of the drydown. Nevertheless, I will enjoy the comfort of my sample, and decide from there whether I am someone who can wear her properly. She really is lovely, and the storytelling of this one really entertains me. Above all, she is comforting, but there is something sinister in her power that I find absolutely delightful.<br />
<br />
The projection leans towards being intimate from the very beginning  this is no beast mode fragrance  but it's still very usable and respectable. A subtle volume suits the fragrance well. It makes you dig for all those mysterious subtleties as it transitions through its various delicious stages. The performance is moderately acceptable as well, with Dorothea lasting some 8 hours, clinging faintly but distinctly to the body through much of that time, and leaves a barely-there trace of spices on skin for several hours more. Her whispers are self-assured and powerful. I tell myself she is not for me, that she is not right for me, that she's too fickle and grand in her tastes, too pricey and high-maintenance, and yet... I keep waking up hearing her calling my name from a dream again.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1420293"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1420293#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="46484" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">

padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1023338" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tandaina"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/987927"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.987927.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tandaina" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Mitsouko-Eau-de-Parfum-25316.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25316.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mitsouko Eau de Parfum"title="Mitsouko Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1023338ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1023338" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/987927">tandaina</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-01-22">01/22/19 15:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>On me this is thin, sharp, and cheap smelling. I adore spicy scents, glad I tested it, as this one doesn't work.<br />
<br />
I honestly can't tell which note or notes is causing the issue, the whole thing is too muddled and confused on my skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="1023338"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=1023338#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent939493" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc939493" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Perfume Beginners"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1092780"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1092780.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Perfume Beginners" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ormonde-Jayne/Ta-if-4922.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4922.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ta'if"title="Ta'if"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma939493ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd939493" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1092780">Perfume Beginners</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-05-04">05/04/18 17:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I thought I would like it before I went to the store and smelled but in fact I don't. To be accurate I dislike it. Countess Dorothea is the mother of Lord George and indeed she smells like a decisive wise old lady. It is definitely not for young girl.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="46484"comment_id="939493"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Ruthless-Countess-Dorothea-46484.html?ccid=939493#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="46484" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>

</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="search-reviews"><search-perfume-reviews :perfume_id="46484":random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]"></search-perfume-reviews></div></div><foundation-tabs></foundation-tabs></reviews-wrapper></div><perfume-shortcut-menu :perfume_id="46484" when-hidden="#toptop"></perfume-shortcut-menu><initialize-status-data></initialize-status-data><div class="cell small-12"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_footer -->

</div></div></div>
            </div>
    <div class="small-12 medium-4 large-3 cell" data-sticky-container>
        <div id="offCanvasRight"
                    class="off-canvas in-canvas-for-large position-right is-closed"
             data-off-canvas>
    <div class="hide-for-large"
         style="width: 2em; position: relative; margin: 0 1em;">
        <button class="close-button" aria-label="Close menu" type="button" data-close>
            <span aria-hidden="true">&times;</span>
        </button>&nbsp;
    </div>
    <div class="strike-title" style="margin-top: 0.5em;"><span>Perfume Encyclopedia</span></div>

    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFFe5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
